alert.note: Alert for Lamoille (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:48PM EST until December 19 at 2:48PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Vermont... Lamoille River At Jeffersonville affecting Lamoille County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lamoille River at Jeffersonville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 451.5 feet, Route 15 in Cambridge becomes impassable. Traffic diversions will be required, and motorists planning to travel Route 15 through Cambridge should allow extra time to detour around the flooded roadway. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. At 453.0 feet, Water will begin to enter streets in Jeffersonville. The north end of Main Street will flood first, and low lying homes will be affected. Portions of Route 15 between Johnson and Fairfax will begin to flood, and there will be widespread field flooding along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 453.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 PM EST Monday was 453.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 453.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 450.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 454.5 feet on 11/01/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
